intro: Medinilla stenobotrys, commonly known as the velvet tangerine medinilla, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that range from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often used in floral arrangements due to their ornamental value. The plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical gardens.
